thread.title: Ty Dillon lands Sprint Cup ride for Homestead-Miami Speedway
thread.title_full: Ty Dillon lands Sprint Cup ride for Homestead-Miami Speedway

author: Jared Turner
title: Ty Dillon lands Sprint Cup ride for Homestead-Miami Speedway
text:
Ty Dillon lands Sprint Cup ride for Homestead-Miami Speedway FOXSports 19 hrs ago Jared Turner © Getty Images KANSAS CITY, KS - OCTOBER 17: Ty Dillon, driver of the #3 Bass Pro Shops/Big Cedar Lodge Chevrolet, stands on the grid with Richard Childress prior to the NASCAR XFINITY Series Kansas Lottery 300 at Kansas Speedway on October 17, 2015 in Kansas City, Kansas. (Photo by Todd Warshaw/Getty Images) Next year's plans for Ty Dillon have yet to be announced.
This much is known, however: Dillon, a full-time XFINITY Series driver, will campaign a No. 33 Richard Childress Racing Chevrolet in this year's Sprint Cup Series season finale at Homestead-Miami Speedway.
AdChoices Dillon, who is nearing the end of his second year in NASCAR's No. 2 division, will drive a Cup car at Homestead for his grandfather's organization with primary sponsorship from Nexium 24HR.
The 23-year-old native of Lewisville, N.C., has six previous Sprint Cup starts, including four this season. Dillon is expected to return to the XFINITY Series next year in the No. 3 car for RCR, or move to Sprint Cup fulltime with RCR or another team.
With three races left in the 2015 XFINITY Series season, Dillon is fourth in the standings and 36 points out of the championship lead.
NEWS: @tydillon to drive No. 33 Nexium 24HR Chevy at @HomesteadMiami in NSCS race pic.twitter.com/gXwpsk2aDH
— #RCRNation (@RCRracing) October 22, 2015 Go to MSN Home
